tool_description: Validates geological survey data for completeness, consistency, and adherence to industry standards, identifying data quality issues and outliers.

data_file_path.description: Path to the geological survey data file (CSV, Excel, or database format)

data_type.description: Type of geological data: drill_hole, geophysical, geochemical, structural, or lithology

validation_level.description: Validation strictness level: basic, standard, or strict

error_messages: File not found: Ensure the data_file_path points to a valid, accessible file location.
Unsupported data type: Use one of [drill_hole, geophysical, geochemical, structural, lithology].
Invalid validation level: Use one of [basic, standard, strict].
Corrupt data file: The file appears to be corrupted or in an unsupported format.
Missing required columns: The data file must contain the minimum required columns for the specified data type.
usage: Provide the path to your geological data file and specify the data type. Optionally set validation_level for different strictness levels. The tool will return validation results and data quality metrics.

validation_status.description: Overall validation result: passed, failed, or warning

error_count.description: Total number of validation errors found

warning_count.description: Total number of validation warnings found
